title: How to Make Parmesan and Sage Biscuits
category_hierarchy: Crackers and Savory Cookies and Biscuits

steps.headline: Mix the butter and Parmesan together in a large bowl.
Add the flour, salt and sage and mix until it turns into a crumble.
steps.description: Add the water bit by bit to the crumbled mixture and gently knead it into the mixture using your fingertips. When a soft dough forms, it is done.

steps.headline: Transfer the dough into a piece of plastic food wrap and refrigerate the covered dough for half an hour.
Take out of the fridge.
steps.description: Preheat the oven to 180ºC/350ºF. Roll the dough out into two long strips. The roll should be about 3 centimeter (1.2 in) thickness.

steps.headline: Cut the roll at about 1 centimeter (0.4 in) intervals to form thick, chunky biscuits.
steps.description: Place each biscuit on a baking tray/sheet for cooking (add baking paper/parchment paper to prevent sticking).

steps.headline: Bake for 10 - 12 minutes, or until golden in colour.
steps.description: Remove and cool on a wire baking rack.

text: Mix the butter and Parmesan together in a large bowl.  Add the flour, salt and sage and mix until it turns into a crumble. Add the water bit by bit to the crumbled mixture and gently knead it into the mixture using your fingertips. When a soft dough forms, it is done. Transfer the dough into a piece of plastic food wrap and refrigerate the covered dough for half an hour.  Take out of the fridge. Preheat the oven to 180ºC/350ºF. Roll the dough out into two long strips. The roll should be about 3 centimeter (1.2 in) thickness. Cut the roll at about 1 centimeter (0.4 in) intervals to form thick, chunky biscuits. Place each biscuit on a baking tray/sheet for cooking (add baking paper/parchment paper to prevent sticking). Bake for 10 - 12 minutes, or until golden in colour. Remove and cool on a wire baking rack.
